article.articleinfo:
&app; - user manual
2003-2005 Heiko Abraham
This is version &manrevision; of &app; user manuals and describt program version &appversion;.
&app;-Team, Heiko Abraham
&app; is a grafical frontend intended by ding for translation and spelling for GNOME. It will use grep and a ispell/aspell dictionary in the background in the same way like some shipped ding-dictinory for translation.
&app; is inspired by gding2, developed by Oliver Grawert, http://www.grawert.net/software/. &app; was writen completly new by H. Abraham, become as extention to gding2 a aspell interface and a ding-dictinory himself.
Heiko Abraham Freiburg, Germany &mymail;
&legal;
Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &app; application or this manual, send a email to author.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; is a grafical frontend for translation or spellchecking of single words. For spellchecking &app; will use a installed aspell (version 0.5) dictionary. For translation &app; will use a ding-like dictionary, that is shipped with gnome-ding.

Since version 2.2 &app; provide the following languages directly:
Spellchecking by using installed apsell dictionaries - af, bg, br, ca, de_ch, cs, cy, da, de_DE, el, eo, es, fo, fr_CH, ga, en_GB, gl, id, is, it, mi, mk, ms, mt, nl, pl, pt, ro, ru, sk, sl, sv, en_CA, uk, en_US, wa, zu.
Thesaurus - de, es
Dictionary - stored in a ding-like format (from ding-project or freedict.org - de-en, de-fr, de-it, de-nl, en-ar, en-de, en-es, en-fr, en-no, en-pt, fr-de, no-en
&app; is designed that a use can easy change or extend new dictionaries, please refere the gconf-entries.
To install new dictionaries please copy the valid file to /usr/share/dict. Also check the gconf-entry for &app; Remember,a easy way is to copy new dictionaries to /usr/share/dict and then press the 'reset'-button in the preferences dialog and start &app; again.
&app; work with Gtk2+ and GNOME2. &app; required as backend aspell (0.50) und grep (2.5.x).

sect2.title: To start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:
If you start &app; now at first time, then all nesseccary configurations will be make automaticly.
If you wish to reset all your configurations of &app; you can use the button 'reset' inside the preferences dialog. As result &app; will be configured same like the first start.

sect2.title: &app; is started
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed:

The &app; main window contains the following elements:
Menubar
The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to work with &app;.
Commandbar
The commandbar ist like a toolbar. At this position you will define your search request.
Result-window
The result-window will contain the result of your search request. The results, if possible, will be shown line by line, like a list.
Statusbar
The statusbar displays information about current &app; activity and contextual information about error messages or search results.

sect1.title: Main Window
sect1.para:
The &app; main window contains the following elements:
Menubar
Commandbar
Result-Window
Statusbar

sect2.title: Menubar
sect2.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to work with &app;.

sect2.title: Commandbar
sect2.para: The Commandbar contain all possible commands of &app; for searching and selecting a dictionary. In the editable 'Search' you can input your word where you wish to lookup for in the dictionary. Byside you will can selected the dictionary, where you want to use for the lookup, like spelling in German or translation.
Hint: The the editabe 'Search' can contain some wildcards like 'dot' as expression for all possible characters.
For start the lookup, press the 'Search'-Button on the commandbar or choose 'search' from the menubar.

sect2.title: Result-Window
sect2.para: The Result-Windows will shown the result of the lookup for the defined word.

If you use a dictionary for spellchecking, then the result-window will show, if the word will be found. If the spelling are incorrect or unknown, then the result-window will contain some suggestions for the correct spelling, if aspell will have found someone.

If you use the ding-dictionary for translation, i.e. german to english, the result-window will shown the matching results for the defined search-word. The results will shown as a list of matches. In the list, you will find some spezials abbreviation. This abbreviations give a better describe for the matched entries, like the sex of the word, or the typical usage or the special branches.
A entry from the result-window you can easy copy into your clipboard by using the contex-menu.

sect2.title: Statusbar
sect2.para: The statusbar at the bottom of the window will displays information about current &app; activity and contextual information. This can be a error messages or the number of search results.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: The usage of &app; is very easy. First you will input your interrested word into the search entry. After you have now input your search-string, please select the prefered dictionary to use for the search. Then press the search-button on the serachbar. In the follow &app; will display in the result-window the results (as a list) for your search request.

sect2.title: Search
sect2.para: The usage of &app; is very easy. First you will input your interrested word into the search entry. After you have now input your search-string, please select the prefered dictionary to use for the search. Then press the search-button on the commandbar. In the following &app; will display inside the result-window all matched results (as a list) for your search request.
Please remember that &app; works only with single words.
Your search entry can also contain wildcards. As example a 'dot' as expression for all possible single characters.
Remember what &app; is developed to work offline. You must have installed the prefered dictionaries.

sect2.title: Results
sect2.para: If your search request was successful then inside the result-window will display all matched results. All matches will display as a list.

If you use the spellchecker then the result list will be a list with a single column. If you translate a seach entry by using a dictionaries, then the result list will have been two columns, each for every languages.

sect2.title: Preferences
sect2.para: At this place you can configure your application.

&app; use for spelling aspell (version 0.50). If a search-entry will be not matched with the aspell dictionary entries, then you will become some suggestions for correct spelling. The sensetivity of the suggestions will be defineable in five steps.
For thesaurus and translation search you can define, how to be match the search entry with the dictionary.
Select the case sensitive option to only find occurrences of the dictionary entries that match the case of the search string that you type.
Select the search only exact word option to only find occurrences of the dictionary entries that match the entire words of the search string that you type.

The category Languages contain a list of available dictionaries that installed on your system and usable for &app;. Choose a Language from the list to activate the availability of this language for &app; inside the commandbar.
Hint: The usable dictionaries and here file are stored as gconf-string, so it is easy to change something without re-compile the application.

The category general contain settings to define your favorite colors and fonts for the result-window. The option button "reset" will set all user define settings from &app; to default value like &app; is started first time.

sect1.title: Abbreviation
sect1.para: If you use the ding-dictionary for translation some words with &app; then in the result-window sometimes you will find some abbreviations. This abbreviations should be better describe the meaning or usage of the founded match.

Abbreviation to describe the sex of the word or part of speech.
Abbreviation
Part of speech
m.
noun, masculine
f.
noun, feminine
n.

pl.

adj.

adv.

prp.

interj.
interjection

[zool.]

sect1.title: Limitations
sect1.para: &app; use als backend for spellchecking aspell. &app; will use aspell directly by using the C-API. But if you have install a newer version of aspell, perhaps with a other C-API interface design, than &app; will not work correct. If you detect some misstakes like wrong charset implementation (like japanese) please feel be free to send a email.

For translation &app; use a ding based dictionary. The search will use only grep for search of matched strings. But it will not know something about the semantic of a lookup. So the search-result is not the best one. Also the ding-dictionary is converted to the UFT8-Charset. This is a little better for special characters, but grep will work very slow with utf8-coded files.

If some people have a solve for this problem, in detail also for the usage of good offline dictionaries in multi-languages, please be free and send a email to the author. Also you can use this source-code and develop a better program under the terms of the GNU GPL2.

sect1.title: Authors
sect1.para:
&app; will be developed at this time by follow authors:
Heiko Abraham (abrahamh@web.de)
At this position, say thank to the work of the Gnome-Project and make Gnome a little better by translation more manuals.
